Description: Rim fragment of East Greek pottery plate; thickened rim with broad flat top; monochrome black with cross-hatching in added white on the top of the rim; white lines on wall inside; two bands at edge of floor and perhaps traces, incised?, of decoration to the centre. 'Black ware'.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 133, pl. XL, no. 373.5)
Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 239, no. 250)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.901)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.5952 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
